IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: The NCMS mission is to lead the rapid development of cross-industry R&D programs to build the global competitiveness of its manufacturing partners.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The NCMS mission is to lead the rapid development of cross-industry R&D programs to build the global competitiveness of its manufacturing partners.
IRS990.Desc: Engineering and Technology Research: Managed collaborative research and development projects and performed services which address the manufacturing needs of North American industry in global economy.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Any legally constituted entity shall be eligible to be a member of NCMS, if in determination of the Board of Directors, such entity is committed to improving manufacturing competitiveness in the United States, Canada, Mexico, and has goals and objectives compatible with those set forth by the NCMS bylaws.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Board of Directors are elected at an annual meeting of members through written ballot.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, Line 9
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Addresses of Board Members are as follows: Dr. Dean L. Bartles, Digital Manufacturing and Design Innovation Institute (DMDI) 1333 North Hickory Street Suite 100 Chicago, IL 60642; Dr. Andrew S. Bicos, Ph.D, The Boeing Company, 5301 Bolsa Avenue, MS H017-D420, Huntington Beach, CA 92647; Alan Ferguson, Eclypse International Corporation, 265 N Joy Street, Suite 150, Corona, CA 92879; Courtney J. Kurfess, Ph.D., P.E., Georgia Institute of Technology, 401 Ferst Drive, Atlanta, GA 30332; Anne M. Tinker, INC Research, 3201 Beechleaf Court, Suite 700, Raleigh, NC 27604; Dr. Dawn R. SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The 990 is reviewed by the BoD Treasurer for submission to the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Annually, employees are required to review, report any conflicts and sign the Conflict of Interest Statement. These signed statements are maintained by Human Resources.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Compensation of CEO and other officers are reviewed annually through industry data and surveys. CEO compensation is approved by the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Upon request, NCMS makes its governing documents, 990, 990-T, conflict of interest policy and audited financial statements available to the public through email or US mail.

TransactionsRelatedOrgGrp.MethodOfAmountDeterminationTxt: Amount equals the total NCMS invoiced NAMC for the calendar year 2015 for services provided to NAMC.
